Description: Rectangular limestone stela of Heqaib and Senet; scene on left of the deceased with sons(all faces obliterated); two rows of Hieroglyphic text along the top; ten columns to right of figured scene.
Curator's comments: Published by H. Polotsky, 'The Stela of Heka-yeb', Journal of Egyptian Archaeology 16 (1930), 194-9. L. Morenz, 'Zwischen Kontext, Intermedialitaet, Intertextualitaet und Individualitaet: Die Selbst-Presentation eines Nedjes-iker (BM 1671)'. Lingua Aegyptia 14 (2006), 389-407
